intro: Tococa subciliata, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and red, fleshy fruits. The plant is evergreen, with glossy, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes around the world.
